info.title: Cards APIs
info.description:
# Overview
 Card APIs provide functionalities to submit new  debit or credit card application; to retrieve cards, statements and application details; to block, unblock, activate card, and activate and deactivate card for overseas usage. 

# Version History
Version | Release date | Link to documentation
--------|--------------|----------------------
v1      | March, 2018   | Base version of API 

# Authentication
<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

# Frequently Asked Question
Q1: How to get list of active Credit/Debit/ATM card summary?

Ans: To get list of active Credit/Debit/ATM using **/parties/{partyId}/cards** with path parameters as party identifier.

Q2: How to get unbilled transactions for given a card?

Ans: To get unbilled transactions for given a card using **/cards/{cardId}/unbilledTransactions** with query parameters as primary card identifier

Q3: How to block multiple Credit/Debit/ATM card in a single request?

Ans: To block multiple Credit/Debit/ATM for any given card identifier using **/cards/block**

# Known Issues
This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us [here](mailto:developers@dbs.com)

# Throttling (Rate Limits)
We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.

Below is more details to control API rate limits

accessToken.description: For accessing the API, a valid JWT token must be passed as part of the headers. You can obtain one through the authorization steps. Please go through the [How it Works](https://www.dbs.com/developers/#/get-started) section for more details.

post.description: Register for new debit card application

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

201.description: Debit card application is successfully submitted

get.description: Return list of active Credit/Debit/ATM cards for a  given party identifier.

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

get.description: Retrieve card details given a tokenized card identifier. Only Credit/Debit/ATM Cards are returned

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

post.description: Block a Credit/Debit/ATM card. More than one cards can be blocked in a single request.

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

201.description: Card(s) is successfully blocked except those highlighted

post.description: Unblock a Credit/Debit/ATM card. More than one cards can be unblocked in a single request

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

201.description: Card(s) is successfully unblocked except those highlighted

post.summary: Deactivate a card for overseas usage

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

201.description: Card is successfully Deactivated for overseas usage.

post.summary: Activate a card for overseas usage
post.description: Activate Credit/Debit card for overseas usage.

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

parameters.name: permanentActivation
parameters.description: Indicates if overseas usage is to be activated permanently or temporarily. 'TRUE' -Permanent Activation, 'FALSE'- Non-Permanent Activation.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Activation start date. Format is YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Activation end date. Format is YYYYMMDD. This date is mandatory only for Non-Permanent Activation.

201.description: Card is successfully activated for Overseas usage

'1' - Contactless payment operation ,
'2' - Contact payment operation

accountNumber.description: Account linked to debit card / Bankcard, not applicable to credit card

isPrimary.description: Indicates if it is a primary account

followupAction.description: Follow up Action to be taken, mandatory for Visa card.Refer mapping for valid values for specific blockReason

CRBRegion.description: Card Recovery Bulletin region code,mandatory for Visa card. Valid values are: 0. A-F and X-Z

sameCardNumber.description: Retain pervious card number, applicable for Credit card or embossed Debit card.

applicationType.description:
Application Type
NEWCC=New Credit Card,
ADDNL=Additional Credit Card,
NEWEDC=New Embossed Debit Card

Application Type
NEWCC=New Credit Card,
ADDNL=Additional Credit Card,
NEWEDC=New Embossed Debit Card,
NEWCL=New Cashline

productId.description: Unique Identifier for a specific product. This is available via retrieval of eligible products API

isPrimaryCard.description: Indicates if it is primary card

phoneType.description: Telephone type. Example: Home, Office, Mobile, Fax. Refer to Code reference for list of possible values.

employmentStatus.description: Status of Employment. Example: Employee, Self Employed. Refer to Common Codes API for the list of values.

addressType.description: Address Type. Example: MAIL, RES, WORK, etc.

country.description: Country Code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code

productId.description: Unique Identifier for a specific product. This is available via retrieval of eligible products API

applicationType.description:
Application Type
NEWCC=New Credit Card,
ADDNL=Additional Credit Card,
NEWEDC=New Embossed Debit Card

isPrimaryCard.description: Indicates if it is primary card

isPermanentResident.description: Indicates if applicant is permanent resident

ownership.description: Ownership of property. Example: 01 - Self Owned, 02 - Mortgaged. Refer to Common Codes API for the list of values

educationLevel.description: Highest Level of Education. Example: University, Diploma. Refer to Common Codes API for the list of values

moreInfo.description: Link to provide more information about the error

linkedAccountNumber.description: Deposit account number linked to Cashline account

minimumBalance.description: Minimum balance in deposit account before auto topUp occurs

isPermanent.description: Indicates if it is a permanent limit

effectiveDate.description: Effective Date, format is YYYY-MM-DD.  This field is applicable when defining new spending limit.

expiryDate.description: Expiry Date, format is YYYY-MM-DD.  This field is applicable when defining new spending limit.

creditLimit.description: Total Credit Limit including temporary credit limit (if any)

isPermanent.description: Indicates permanent activation for overseas usage

totalAmountDue.description: Total amount due, including current balance

totalInterestAmount.description: Total Interest Amount Charged in this cycle

currentBalance.description: Cycle to date closing balance amount

previousPoints.description: Reward Points brought forwarded from previous cycles

newPointsEarned.description: Reward Points  earned in this cycle

redeemedPoints.description: Reward Points  redeemed in this cycle

adjustedPoints.description: Reward Points adjusted in this cycle

items.description: Details of Eligible Products for a given customer. Supported products are cards, cashline

cardType.description: Code to represent the type of card
Type of card, eg. DEBIT, CREDIT

cardBrand.description: Card Brand, eg. VISA, MasterCard, AMEX

docsOnly.description: Indicates if only documents are added to an existing application

cardBrand.description: Card Brand, Example: VISA, MasterCard, AMEX

productId.description: Unique Identifier for a specific card

productSubType.description: Product Sub Type, Example:04 - DBS VISA Debit Card, 06 - POSB Passion Debit Card, 07 - DBS UnionPay Debit Card

cardNumberToReplace.description: Current card number to be replaced

productType.description: Product Type. Only selected Current/Savings accounts are supported, DBS Current Account, DBS Savings Account, POSB Savings Account, Multi-Currency Account, Foreign Currency Current Account

isPrimaryAccount.description: Indicates if it is a primary account

partyDetl.description: Party details for the debit card application

educationLevel.description: Highest Level of Education. Example: 01 - University, 02 - Diploma, 03 - Pre-University, 04 - Secondary, 05 - Primary, 09 - Others

employmentStatus.description: Employment Status. Example: 01 - Employee, 02 - Self Employed, 03 - Variable / Commission Earner, 04 - Retired, 05 - Others

residenceType.description: Type of residence. Example: 01 - HDB 1-Room, 02 - HDB 2-Room, 03 - HDB 3-Room, 04 - HDB 4-Room, 05 - HDB 5-Room, 06 - Shophouse, 07 - Condominium, Apartment 08 - Terrace, Simi-Detached, Bungalow, 99 - Others

residenceOwnership.description: Ownership of residence. Example: 01 - Self owned, 02 - Mortgaged, 03 - Rented, 04 - Parent's, 05 - Employer's, 06 - Others

phoneType.description: Telephone type. Refer to Code reference for list of possible values.
